column4: hi, I'd need to find out 32bit version of libgtk-1.2.so.0 for my 64bit machine, anyone knows where to get that from?
you need a 32bit version of libgtk1.2
head to the packages site on ubuntu and manually download the package then install it
this may break your system, so its your own risk
then how do the devs know there is an issue?
probably in no way. except is an outdated package a bug?
report a bug and it may get updated
just enough to not include the -P :)
you think I could compile my own package which would replace this one?
it avoids me writing one script so it'd be nice.
no reason why not, i suggest you run:  ubuntu-bug util-linux   and report the issues
